content: This report analyzes forest management provisions enacted in the 115th Congress through two legislative vehicles: The Stephen Sepp Wildfire Suppression Funding and Forest Management Activities Act and the Agricultural Improvement Act of 2018. These laws address forest management on federal and nonfederal lands, as well as forestry research. The 115th Congress enacted forest management provisions through two laws, including the 2018 farm bill. These laws address forest management on federal and nonfederal lands, as well as forestry research. The focus is on federal forest management provisions that change how the Forest Service and Bureau of Land Management manage their lands. The Forest Service (FS) and Bureau of Land Management (BLM) manage vast amounts of land, with FS overseeing 193 million acres of the National Forest System (NFS) and BLM managing 246 million acres of public lands. The report discusses laws like the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) and the Healthy Forests Restoration Act (HFRA) that authorize forest management activities. The 115th Congress enacted provisions affecting how FS and BLM implement these activities, covering project planning, wildland fire management, forest restoration programs, and more. The report summarizes and analyzes provisions enacted by the 115th Congress that affect how the Forest Service (FS) and Bureau of Land Management (BLM) implement activities such as project planning, wildland fire management, and forest restoration programs. It categorizes the provisions into project planning, wildland fire management, forest management and restoration programs, and miscellaneous, discussing relevant issues, changes made, and potential congressional concerns. The complexity of the issue, nature of changes, and congressional interest determine the depth of coverage for each provision. The report also includes side-by-side tables comparing forest-related provisions in each law to prior laws. The report discusses provisions enacted by the 115th Congress affecting Forest Service and Bureau of Land Management activities. It covers project planning, wildland fire management, forest management, and restoration programs.
